# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in B (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in B is a musical entity that consists of the notes B, D#, Fx (G), and A. This arpeggio, when played as a C shape on the guitar, creates a unique and colorful sound due to the augmented 5th (Fx or G) in the sequence. It is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and other contemporary genres to add tension and color to musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- D# (Major 3rd)
- Fx (Augmented 5th)
- A (Minor 7th)

## Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in B (C shape) has a vibrant and tense quality due to the augmented 5th (Fx or G) interval. It adds a sense of dissonance and unpredictability to the music, making it an excellent choice for creating tension or resolving into different chords. When used in improvisation or composition, this arpeggio brings a modern and sophisticated flavor to the music, contributing to its overall complexity and interest.
